character.name: Quintus Sanguinarius Horatius
character.brief_description: Senior Arcani operative and interrogator with 25 years of intelligence tradecraft. Invaluable and dangerous — the best interrogator in the Arcani, bone-deep weary, carrying weight of decades of violence and secrets.
character.full_description: Horatius is a senior intelligence officer in the Arcani — Roman secret service operating in the shadows of political power. Known as "The Bloodhound" and "The Interrogator," he has spent 25 years doing what others wouldn't: interrogation, extraction, making problems disappear. He appears unremarkable — plain dress, deliberate movement, the quality of someone who has been watching before anyone knew he arrived. The work has become escape from introspection. The conscience he believes he buried long ago is not dead; it has been working in silence. His reckoning — whether redemption through sacrifice or descent into cynicism — is coming due.
character.origin: Unknown (military is the only family he references)
character.occupation: Senior Arcani operative; interrogator; intelligence officer
character.opening_state: Senior operative at end of long career; invaluable and dangerous; bone-deep weary; still the best interrogator in the Arcani
character.key_transformation: The question he will not ask asking itself; conscience surfacing; reckoning forced
character.closing_state: Either redemption through sacrifice — or descent into the cynicism that was always the easier path
character.arc_preview: From indispensable operative working as escape from introspection, through accumulated weight pressing against his framework, to moment that forces the accounting he has been avoiding
